body.p: DingsBums?! gives the possibility to syntax highlight syllables based on vocals with special accents. This is especially useful for learning pronounciation based on e.g. pinyin for Chinese.
Support for syllables is turned on in the learnign stack properties under the "Syllables" tab.

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing syllables properties in learnign stack properties

body.p: The application provides immediate feedback for syllables in different colors already during input. Additionaly there are shortcut buttons for the accents recognized by the program for easier use. Depending on the fonts and characters supported by your operating system not all accents might be displayed correctly on the screen. Accent caron (hasek), which should be used in pinyin instead of accent breve is e.g. not always supported. The tooltip text will indicate, what character should be displayed.

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing editing with syllables

body.p: Syllables are highlighted in all sitautions if turned on, e.g. while learning:

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing learning with syllables highlighting turned on

body.p: The colors per accent group can be configured individually using the accoring setting in preferences.

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing preferences for syllables highlighting color by accent group
